results.title: Justice: a kindness cup. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Country Education Project, Daryl Wayland and Michael Vance
results.brief_description: Part 1 (28min): Dr. Jonathan Sher, visiting American educationalist, Dr Don Edgar and Peter Couchman explore and develop issues from “A Kindness Cup.” These include whether justice or revenge is sought, what is achieved, the connection between power and justice and between disdvantage and justice. Part 2 (28min) continues the discussion and cites specific examples to illustrate the “nature of justice”, punishment, miscarriage of justice and social justice.

results.title: Justice, liberty and law: an introduction
results.brief_description: The American Bill of Rights provides a focal point for discussion of the ideal of justice. What is right and fair? Rights of the individual are raised for discussion. Individual rights to protest and the need to keep law and order are presented as conflicting interests. A number of people who hold opposing views are interviewed. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Just weeds
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Evelyn Spice and Sol Dworkin
results.brief_description: Spread by water and wind, by birds and man’s carelessness, weeds cost the Canadian farmer over one hundred million dollars each year. Several varieties of common weeds are identified, with a warning against the danger from each. Control measures such as the use of clean seed, special crops, sheep grazing, cutting and spraying are illustrated and, throughout, proper cultivation is shown as the basic remedy.

results.title: Just the job
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures, Jenny Day and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Designed as an aid for those who are about to leave school and try for a place in the work force. Outlines the kind of trade and post-trade courses available, as well as basic apprenticeship courses and development courses for various skills. Explains the need to find out as much as possible about a job, to ask questions, and talk to teachers.

results.title: Just swimming
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Tom Williamson and John Cooper
results.brief_description: A motivational film showing the variety of water activities that can be enjoyed once the skills of swimming have been acquired. Features scuba diving, water ballet, water hockey and basketball, competitive swimming, surfing and marathon swimming.

results.title: Just Out of Reach
results.brief_description: A portrayal of a young woman’s conflict with an unresponsive world. Cath is rushed to hospital after a suicide attempt and the film traces back to her adolescence to reveal what has led to a despair so severe that suicide appears to be her only option. Her conflicts with her family, principally with her father, are later identified in her relationship with her husband. Each leads her to attempt suicide. Both attempts are the result of her utter despair at the loss of the love of the person who matters the most to her.

results.title: Just out of reach
results.creator_credit: Portrait Films, Ross Matthews and Linda Blagg
results.brief_description: A contemporary drama featuring Lorna Lesley, Sam Neill and Martin Vaughan. Portrays a young woman’s conflicts with her parents, her love affair while still at school, her marriage to her former teacher, their subsequent separation and the near disastrous effects it has upon her life. In tracing an archetypal journey from adolescence to adulthood, the film probes both the ‘silences of family life’ and the tenuousness of relationships. Suitable for senior students. Teacher preview recommended.
